question.body: If the p-value is 0.103, based upon the same data, which confidence interval could be the 95% confidence interval for p?

response.feedback: Correct. Since 0.103 > 0.05, we cannot reject the null hypothesis. Our value for p must be in the interval.
Incorrect. Note that the p-value is > 0.05, so we cannot reject the null hypothesis. Our value for p is a plausible one.
Incorrect. Note that the p-value is > 0.05, so we cannot reject the null hypothesis. Our value for p is a plausible one.
Incorrect. Note that the p-value is > 0.05, so we cannot reject the null hypothesis. Our value for p must be in the interval, not our p-value.
